Hit Points.Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per warlock level after 1st

Equipment: a light crossbow and 20 bolts or any simple weapon
a component pouch or an arcane focus
a scholar's pack or a dungeoneer's pack
Class Features.Otherworldly Patron: At 1st level, you have struck a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

Pact Magic.Description: Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells.
Pact Magic.Cantrips: You know two cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list. You learn additional warlock cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Warlock table.
Pact Magic.Spell Slots: The Warlock table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your warlock spells of 1st through 5th level. All of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
Pact Magic.Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher: At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the warlock spell list. You learn more spells as you gain levels in this class. Additionally, when you gain a level, you can replace one of the spells you know with another spell from the warlock spell list of the same level.
Pact Magic.Spellcasting Ability: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells. Use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell and when making an attack roll with one.
Pact Magic.Spell save DC: 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Pact Magic.Spell attack modifier: your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Pact Magic.Spellcasting Focus: You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

Class Features.Eldritch Invocations: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed Eldritch Invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with magical abilities. At 2nd level, you gain two eldritch invocations. You gain additional invocations at certain levels and can replace them when you gain a level.

Pact Boon.Description: At 3rd level, your otherworldly patron bestows a gift upon you. You gain one of the following features of your choice.
Pact Boon.Pact of the Blade: You can create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You are proficient with it, and it counts as magical. The weapon disappears if more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more.
Pact Boon.Pact of the Chain: You learn the find familiar spell and can cast it as a ritual. You can choose special forms for your familiar. Additionally, your familiar can make one attack with its reaction when you take the Attack action.
Pact Boon.Pact of the Tome: Your patron gives you a Book of Shadows. You can cast three cantrips from any class's spell list at will. If you lose the book, you can receive a replacement from your patron.
Pact Boon.Pact of the Talisman: You receive an amulet that can aid the wearer. They can add a d4 to an ability check. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.
Pact Boon.Pact of the Star Chain (UA): The Seeker grants you a chain forged from starlight. You know the augury spell and can cast it as a ritual. You can gain advantage on an Intelligence check while carrying the chain.

Class Features.Ability Score Improvement: At 4th, 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th levels, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20.
Class Features.Eldritch Versatility (Optional): Whenever you gain an Ability Score Improvement, you can replace one cantrip, Pact Boon option, Mystic Arcanum spell, or Eldritch Invocation as specified.
Class Features.Mystic Arcanum: At 11th level, you gain a 6th-level spell that you can cast once without expending a spell slot. At higher levels, you gain more arcanum spells that you can cast in this way. You regain all uses of Mystic Arcanum after a long rest.
Class Features.Eldritch Master: At 20th level, you can regain all your expended spell slots by spending 1 minute entreating your patron. You must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.
